intro: Eudema pectinata, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is known for its hairy, velvety texture on both its leaves and stems, which gives it its common name. Eudema pectinata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It plays a role in both ecological systems and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
